description: A shunt capacitor or reactor or switchable bank of shunt capacitors or reactors. A section of a shunt compensator is an individual capacitor or reactor.  A negative value for reactivePerSection indicates that the compensator is a reactor. ShuntCompensator is a single terminal device.  Ground is implied.

contents.name: aVRDelay
contents.description: Time delay required for the device to be connected or disconnected by automatic voltage regulation (AVR).

contents.name: grounded
contents.description: Used for Yn and Zn connections. True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

contents.name: maximumSections
contents.description: The maximum number of sections that may be switched in.

contents.name: nomU
contents.description: The voltage at which the nominal reactive power may be calculated. This should normally be within 10% of the voltage at which the capacitor is connected to the network.

contents.name: normalSections
contents.description: The normal number of sections switched in.

contents.name: sections
contents.description:
Shunt compensator sections in use.
Starting value for steady state solution. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete shunt compensators has yet been designed, a solutions where a narrow voltage band force the sections to oscillate or accommodate for a continuous solution as input.

contents.name: switchOnCount
contents.description: The switch on count since the capacitor count was last reset or initialized.

contents.name: switchOnDate
contents.description: The date and time when the capacitor bank was last switched on.

contents.name: voltageSensitivity
contents.description: Voltage sensitivity required for the device to regulate the bus voltage, in voltage/reactive power.
